title: Marine Le Pen axes party's vice president
subhead: David Rachline has resigned from his positions and will not be nominated the party's candidate for mayor in Fréjus, southern France. An image Rachline posted of himself with members of a neo-Nazi group appears to have triggered the fall of a figure already weakened by two corruption investigations.

title: 'Mektoub, My Love: Canto Due': Abdellatif Kechiche's Mediterranean gem
subhead: The director of 'Blue Is the Warmest Color' is releasing the final installment of his trilogy set in Sète, weaving a tale of intrigue and burning desire. It is a film of reconciliations and reunions, with characters who never fail to surprise.

title: Anti-obesity drugs fuel Babybel's US boom
subhead: Bel, the French family-owned company, plans to invest €60 million in a second Babybel production line at its Sablé-sur-Sarthe factory in eastern France and is considering expanding its American facility.

The significant trade imbalance between France and China
subhead: Even as Chinese competition increasingly undermines French industries, including in innovation, many French companies argue that maintaining a presence in China remains essential. President Emmanuel Macron is visiting the country from December 3 to 5.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio and Paul Thomas Anderson: Two Hollywood stars in Paris after the battle
subhead: Absent during the European promotion of the film 'One Battle After Another,' the American actor and director reunited in France to talk about Hollywood and their 30-year friendship.

title: Marseille grapples with drug trafficking: 'They are so many and they have so much money'
subhead: After the murder of Mehdi Kessaci, the brother of an activist against drug trafficking, Le Monde spoke with residents of housing projects, social workers, judges and police officers. They described a growing sense of powerlessness and danger.
